column4: what is the best option if i want to share files on my system with others, without exposing the whole file system?
-> can you clarify what you meant by share?  users have read/write priviledges to your files?
yes, or write privileges to parts of the directory structure
-> there are different ways, samba, nfs, sftp ... are they users of your system? or just grabs the files?

i only want them to have access to files, not a shell on the machine. And i'd prefer for it to have high performance and be secure. I've already looked at sftp but there's apparently no way to not expose the whole system or building lots of dummy dirs for a chroot
-> the harder part is for them to write, reading a file is easier with tools like apache or web servers
indeed. I find it odd that in this day and age, there's no such simple thing as a secure file server protocol
one that has actual implementations, that is
-> there are, its just you have to do some work
what do you propose?
-> for just the users to see? apache or tomcat is more than enuff
i want write access too
to write, proftp  server
you mean with SSL encryption then, i suppose
-> yes, proftpd uses ssl or openssh somewhere in the pipeline i believe
there is no server that uses openssh, unfortunately
apart from openssh itself
-> i dont know the internals of proftpd , perhaps google for it
ok thanks, i will try with ftp over ssl
not ftp over ssl, look into tools like proftpd
proftpd uses ftp over ssl
okay, there are more alternatives, just google for them
yes, but the only encrypted alternative is ftp over ssl
